page.title: 05EDUCATION
page.content: {EDUCATION} St. Keverne School was opened in 1877 and occupied one building which is now the Infant section. In 1969 a new building was opened for the Junior pupils and the whole school now accommodates 91 children. It is the largest Primary School on the Lizard Peninsula with 5 teachers, 4 of whom are full time. The first headmaster was Mr Thomas Pengelly (meaning head of copse in Cornish!) It has an outdoor swimming pool, 10.5 metres long and a large hall/gym. The original school is built of granite and has a new slate roof. The Junior school is constructed of block with a large flat and leaky roof. There is a kitchen, headmaster's office and two classrooms. The school is fortunate in having an extensive outdoor play area.
